channel.title: No temp file
channel.description:
Hey folks,
Not another difficult questions about aligning divs this time, but is there any way to stop saving the website in temporary internet files (in IE, firefox uses %temp% i believe?). And i do not mean the meta tag NO-CACE because it still does save the .htm in the folder :)
Thank you :D
~S!ms

item.title: No temp file
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Wow, don’t you love MS’s resolution for it? http://support.microsoft.com/kb/222064/

If the meta tag doesn’t prevent it, then I don’t know of a way in plain html. You might want to try using a server side alternative and see if it makes a difference. For example, in php:

header('Pragma: no-cache');
header('Cache-Control: no-cache');

Not positive that’ll work, but give it a shot.

Read full topic

item.title: No temp file
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

no dont think so because the program needs a place to stroe it to save memory

Read full topic

item.title: No temp file
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

I dont know what it is possible using meta-tags, it would have to be a browser setting.

May I ask why you are trying to stop it?

Read full topic
